newsitem.title: UK: IPE natgas rises as hours extended after fire alarm.
newsitem.headline: IPE natgas rises as hours extended after fire alarm.

text.p: IPE natural gas futures moved up on Thursday afternoon as 60 lots were traded, all at higher prices, in July, October and November.

July traded at 9.80 pence a therm, only fractionally up from the previous settlement level of 9.79 pence, and October and November traded at 11.95 pence and 13.15 pence, up 0.075 pence and 0.085 pence respectively.
The October trade was done at 1524 GMT, well after the normal close of the contract. But trading was extended for half an hour following a fire alarm at the exchange.
Each of the 12 contract months was bid by the close, although offers were only posted in November and June.
